meanings.definition: A list of cases in court for trial.
meanings.sent1: The judge reviewed the docket to prepare for the upcoming trials.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer added the new case to the court's docket.
meanings.sent3: The docket was so long that the judge needed extra time to go through it all.
meanings.sent4: The docket resembled a mountain of legal challenges waiting to be conquered.
meanings.sent5: The docket, like a map, guided the court through the cases ahead.

meanings.definition: A list of things to be done or considered.
meanings.sent1: I always keep a docket of tasks to complete each day.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the items on the meeting's docket.
meanings.sent3: His docket of chores seemed never-ending, like a bottomless pit.
meanings.sent4: The docket of responsibilities weighed on her mind like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The docket, like a roadmap, guided them through their plans for the week.

meanings.definition: To make a record of something.
meanings.sent1: She needed to docket the important details before they were forgotten.
meanings.sent2: The secretary will docket the meeting minutes for future reference.
meanings.sent3: He decided to docket the memory in his mind like a mental note.
meanings.sent4: The historian wanted to docket the rare artifact for preservation.
meanings.sent5: Docketing the information was crucial for accurate documentation.
